Andrew Detmer.Action: Films his family members, including his sick mother and confrontational father, capturing their struggles rather than interacting warmly.
Shows fear and anxiety when his angry father pounds on his door, indicating a vulnerable and possibly withdrawn demeanor.
Buys a camera and decides to film his troubled home life, showing initiative and a desire to document reality.
Responds to his intoxicated father with some guardedness but does not escalate situation or open the door immediately, showing some situational awareness.
Exhibits fear and anxiety in his voice when confronted by his father, suggesting lack of emotional control or confidence.
Compliments his mom when she asks if she looks awful, reassuring her she looks great.
Explains he is filming to protect his mom and hopes to get custody from his dad, showing concern for her well-being.
Decides to film daily life and interactions to gather evidence to support custody of his mom, showing foresight and strategic thinking.
Is somewhat vague or defensive when questioned about filming everything, possibly indicating social awkwardness or lack of confidence in explaining his intentions.
Retrieves his camera after Bryce kicks it back to him and checks on it.
Complies by turning off the camera when the cheerleader asks him to, avoiding escalating conflict.
Struggles to assert himself and retrieve the camera from Bryce initially, showing a lack of control in the social conflict.
Demonstrates awkwardness and social discomfort when confronted by the cheerleader, failing to convincingly explain his actions.
Declines invitation to party, explaining he doesn't like parties.
Stands still filming bullies who verbally threaten him and throw a bottle but does not retaliate.
Runs back to his house after confrontation rather than escalating conflict.
Refuses to go to the party despite encouragement, showing social withdrawal but some decisiveness.
Insists on bringing the camera despite advice not to, indicating a strong sense of purpose and confidence in his actions.
Stands still and films threatening hoodlums instead of avoiding or confronting, demonstrating poor situational awareness and lack of self-protective skill.
Runs back to his house after being threatened and nearly hit, showing practical self-preservation despite earlier passivity.
Works diligently on his laptop in his room, indicating focus and self-discipline.
Keeps working quietly despite father's aggressive interruption.
Follows Matt to party to avoid being alone, tries to engage but is socially awkward and detached.
Skulks around party silently, filming instead of interacting meaningfully with others.
Says he is uploading what he shot and talks about keeping a back-up.
Continues working on his laptop even when his father enters and confronts him.
After being slapped out of his chair, sits on the floor in silence without reacting.
Questions Matt about whether the party location is correct and seems unsure.
Skulks around the party silently and detached, only filming without engaging with others.
Responds quietly to Casey's friendly approach and backs away without confrontation.
Maintains calm and does not retaliate or escalate when Austin verbally threatens and throws beer on him.
Withdraws alone after the incident and is overheard crying, showing vulnerability but no outward aggression.
Answers Austin calmly and tries to de-escalate the situation by denying filming anyone specific and complying with Austin's demands to say 'okay'.
Simply backs away when questioned by Casey and does not explain or assert purpose confidently.
Reacts passively while being confronted aggressively by Austin, lowering the camera and backing up but does not assert himself or attempt to leave confidently.
Hesitates to join Steve, expresses caution about trespassing in the woods.
Responds to Steve's friendly greeting and invitation with some reserve but does not reject outright.
Hesitates to join Steve and unsure about using the camera or whether they are supposed to be there.
Fumbles with the camera, unsure if the light is on, but manages to turn it on eventually.
Keeps the camera focused nervously on the hole, shows caution and tries to communicate boundaries by asking others not to push him or do anything harmful.
Engages in casual banter with Steve about future success and memories, showing some friendliness and connection.
Seems hesitant and reserved, showing no hostility or aggression in the interaction.
Keeps the camera fixed steadily on the murky black hole, showing focus and composure despite nervousness.
Reluctantly takes a tentative step towards a dangerous unknown hole in the woods after being urged, showing caution but also hesitation.
Expresses nervousness and asks others not to push or do anything to provoke him, indicating lack of confidence in a tense situation.
Responds to friends' encouragement and follows them into a dangerous, claustrophobic hole despite hesitation.
Moves towards the dark, unknown hole despite obvious risks and claustrophobic conditions.
Hesitates and verbally declines at first to enter the hole, showing some caution.
Abruptly goes into the unstable, dark hole after others, ignoring warnings.
Turns the camera back to others to share what he is witnessing, attempting communication.
Follows Steve into the darkness despite uncertainty, asks questions about the situation.
Admits nervousness and uncertainty about the environment.
Follows Steve into an unknown, dark tunnel despite uncertainty and nervousness.
Does not understand Matt’s reference to Plato's allegory of the cave and shows nervousness about the discussion.
Quickly switches from normal vision to night vision when the light goes out, attempting to adapt to changing conditions.
Expresses hesitation about filming the crystalline structure, says 'Guys maybe...maybe we shouldn't...'
Expresses concern about filming the glowing crystalline structure, sensing potential harm.
Hesitates but reaches out to touch the light clouds, causing permanent camera damage.
Attempts to communicate warnings and express caution to the others.
Laughs along with friends during playful baseball game, participates in lighthearted fun.
Uses a newer, better camera set on a tripod to film, indicating preparation and upgrading equipment.
Participates in playful baseball tests with friends and laughs, showing social engagement and confidence behind the camera.
Improves personal appearance by grooming, suggesting increased self-care and confidence.
Smiles and points to the suspended baseball trick, showing shared excitement.
Rushes to help Matt after he gets hit, laughing with friends.
Explains how to use telekinesis to Steve and Matt patiently.
Points to the suspended baseball confidently, seemingly in control of his powers.
Explains the technique to Steve for controlling objects mentally with a clear and practical metaphor (pretending the object is on a plate).
Smiles and laughs during play, showing relaxed and confident social interaction while using powers.
Gets a trickle of blood from his nose but does not seem bothered, indicating physical strain or overexertion without addressing it.
Mocks Matt playfully while helping with the Lego set, then laughs together.
Joins in humorously when Steve asks for advice on girls, lightening the mood.
Expresses desire for a barrier between himself and others, indicating emotional distance.
Successfully uses telekinetic powers to assemble a LEGO set quickly and impressively.
Mocks Matt in a playful but confident manner, indicating social confidence and self-assuredness.
Refers to himself and others jokingly as 'mistress' when giving relationship advice, showing humor and social engagement.
Admits to wanting a barrier between himself and others when questioned about filming, indicating self-awareness though also a hint of emotional distancing.
Does computer repair and makes a lot of money to support his family.
Shows awareness of his family situation and financial responsibilities.
Hesitates or unsure about custody of his mother.
Turns off the camera upon hearing shouting and verbal abuse from the house.
Engages in casual, friendly banter with Matt and Steve during lunch.
Filming from behind and lagging behind while Matt and Steve enter Wal-Mart.
Turns off the camera amid shouting and tension in his household.
Questions the metaphor used by Matt with a logical alternative explanation.
Lags behind filming while others proceed forward, possibly showing lack of coordination or initiative.
Says 'I got it' when told to stay back, implying confidence and willingness to manage filming.
Animates a teddy bear to entertain a toddler, causing delight.
Helps prank a man by yanking him into candy rack, joining in laughter with friends.
Asks a friend if he likes him, showing vulnerability and desire for connection.
Brings a teddy bear to life to entertain a toddler, showing control and creativity with his powers.
Successfully pulls a prank on a man chewing gum, demonstrating precise use of his abilities.
Attempts to take charge but retreats when others suggest running unnecessarily, indicating some hesitation or lack of confidence.
Calls Matt an asshole when confronted about being hard to talk to, shows hostility.
Acknowledges Matt's invitation to the party and thanks him, indicating some gratitude.
Participates in a prank involving a car, showing willingness to engage with peers (neutral, no direct indication of kindness or trustworthiness).
Jokes about being stuck with a Taco Bell wrapper for his nosebleed, joining in lighthearted banter with friends.
Tries to get a better angle filming the woman returning to her car, causes her to stare at him.
Hold up a Taco Bell wrapper as a makeshift blood-soaked tissue because he lacks a proper one, showing adaptability but some lack of readiness.
Tries to get a better angle of the woman returning to her car while filming, demonstrating initiative and attention to detail.
Hands off the camera to Steve, sharing control and responsibility.
Laughs and uses powers to crush the truck aggressively causing an accident.
Immediately apologizes and urges friends to calm down after the accident.
Flicks his hand at the truck, causing it to crash into the water, unintentionally using his power with dramatic effect but then immediately shows regret and apologizes.
Attempts to lift the sinking truck telekinetically to help the injured man.
Asks repeatedly if the injured man is okay and if the police have been called.
Films the rescue moment but does not interfere beyond trying to help.
Attempts to telekinetically lift the sinking car despite pain, showing initiative and willingness to help.
Films the rescue instead of assisting physically, showing passivity in a critical moment.
Asks questions about the injured man’s condition and the call to police, demonstrating awareness and concern.
Is largely passive and follows others’ lead rather than taking command or decisively acting.
Acknowledges hurting someone but tries to justify it by saying the victim was 'being an asshole'.
Appears reluctant and defensive when Matt insists on rules about not harming others and controlling powers.
Interacts quietly and shows a moment of curiosity or gentleness by telekinetically lifting a spider in his room.
Checks if Matt is mad at him, shows concern about their relationship.
Listens quietly to Matt's advice about thinking before acting, shows willingness to understand.
Laughs while dangling 5000 feet in the air, plays catch and performs flying tricks with friends who cheer him on.
Saves Steve's life during a dangerous fall, despite being injured himself.
Communicates concern and tries to check on others after the incident.
Remains calm and manages to save Steve's life during a chaotic, dangerous event involving an airplane wake and free-fall.
Experiences physical injury (bleeding eyes, nose, mouth) and exhaustion after the event but shows presence of mind to confirm the camera captured everything.
Communicates frustration when not heard by others during flight.
Cheers friends on and participates in shared excitement, laughing behind the camera
Flatly refuses to give a beat to Matt, teasingly cold
Cheers from behind the camera, joining in enthusiasm confidently.
Flatly refuses to give a beat when asked by Matt, showing social detachment or lack of engagement.
Cheering with friends and playfully manipulating glowsticks with Matt.
Protests singing along because he doesn't know the lyrics.
Filming friends but not really focusing on anything, appearing somewhat detached.
Admits he has never had sex when responding to friends, showing a degree of openness.
Short response to Matt about the day being best, reflecting subdued emotional engagement.
Films with interest but does not focus intently on his filming, showing some lack of concentration or engagement.
Protests singing along to 'Shake That' because he doesn't know the lyrics, showing some self-awareness about his limitations.
Engages in playful manipulation of glowstick fluid with Matt, enjoying creative interaction.
Admits to never having had sex when Matt brags about his own lack, showing honesty but also social insecurity.
Joins a casual, somewhat aimless group interaction before falling into drowsiness, indicating passivity and lack of active leadership or initiative.
Admits to feeling scared and stupid about returning to the unstable area.
Responds to police officer presence with profanity: 'Fuck you, pig.'
Dismisses altruism and charity as 'lame' without much consideration.
Admits feeling scared to return to dangerous area, but comes back despite fear.
Mocks Matt by calling police officers 'pig' in response to Matt's earnestness.
Asks questions to understand Matt's word 'altruism,' showing willingness to learn.
Dismisses Matt's idealistic talk about charity as 'lame' without understanding it, showing limited insight.
Invites Steve to go into the city with him despite rush hour, genuinely wanting to hang out longer.
Holding the camera loosely and engaging in chill, friendly conversation with friends.
Expresses uncertainty and vulnerability about his family situation and his feelings.
Declines to participate in talent show, expressing shyness and self-doubt.
Expresses uncertainty and inability to understand or process family difficulties ('I don’t know anymore. I don’t know how to feel.')
Refuses to participate in talent show citing shyness and lack of talent, but does engage in the conversation and eventually seems persuaded
Spends time with friends and allows Steve to help him, indicating some social confidence or at least openness to support
Apologizes and says he'll try to do better after being harshly scolded by Mr. Detmer.
Avoids directly addressing questions about strange behavior; remains evasive.
Tries to explain his situation despite pressure from Mr. Detmer
Is confronted and called out on dishonesty and sneaking around, indicating lack of openness and possibly poor decision-making
Apologizes and promises to try to improve
Wears a tuxedo and is presented on stage amid mixed crowd reaction
Shrugs off audience laughter after fumbling cards, then magically catches them and impresses the crowd.
Annoyed when offered soda by Steve, then snatches it away abruptly.
Playfully pantomimes with Steve, showing a sense of camaraderie despite messing up transporting water.
Bows a second time to the crowd, enjoying the attention and crowd's reaction.
Fumbles the deck of cards and spills them, causing audience laughter.
Recovers cards to his hands seemingly with skill, causing the audience to go wild.
Juggles six balls at once, demonstrating advanced coordination and skill.
Annoyed by Steve offering soda, stops juggling leaving balls suspended and snatches soda, showing control but possible lack of social tact.
Transporting buckets of water but spills everywhere, shoddy performance.
Pantomimes 'Well, you try' to Steve, showing a casual attitude toward his mistakes.
Participates in the impressive water rewinding trick, greatly impressing the audience.
Takes separate bow and bows again, eliciting strong positive audience reaction and showing confidence.
Sheepishly acknowledges compliments and praise from partygoers
Engages in friendly banter and remembers a classmate Monica, recognizing her with some warmth
Agrees to join Monica's beer-pong team despite being a little tipsy
Responds to others' compliments at party with modesty and acknowledges praise sheepishly.
Remembers Monica's hair color and identifies her despite some initial confusion.
Agrees to join a beer-pong team while tipsy, leaving the camera unattended.
Shows genuine curiosity about meaning of 'hubris' and 'seriously' asking for clarification.
Others at the party cheer him on playing beer-pong, showing he is socially engaged.
Is upstairs hooking up with someone, indicating some social interaction but possibly detached from the main group.
Is being supported and loved by a friend who acknowledges his anger but still expresses love and familial connection.
Dominates at beer-pong and participates confidently at the party.
Leaves camera unattended at the party, allowing others to take it.
Reassures his mother by saying, 'Mom, it's going to be okay, okay? Just try to get through, it's going to be okay.' during a painful situation.
Fumbles with the camera and rushes out the door after hearing screaming indicating distress downstairs.
Fumbles with the camera, drops it while trying to operate it.
Attempts to comfort his mother amidst a crisis, speaks calmly despite tension.
Engages in a violent physical altercation with his father, including slapping, backhanding, and choking him.
Despite the violence, shows signs of emotional distress and panic with gasping sobs after the confrontation.
Defends himself effectively by backhanding his father, floors him, and uses his powers precisely to control and intimidate him.
Calmly picks up the camera and levels it on his father after the physical altercation, showing control and focus.
After the fight, Andrew panics and gasps, then abruptly runs out of the house and launches into the air.
Pushes himself to film the dangerous storm despite Steve's warnings, showing recklessness but also dedication to his interests.
Rejects Steve's concern angrily, saying 'You don't give a shit, stop acting like you care!'
Apologizes sincerely after Steve expresses his genuine care and support.
Touches the bottom of a thundercloud despite obvious danger and receives an electric shock, ignoring Steve's warnings to get down immediately.
Decides to film the storm up close to capture something never filmed before, showing initiative and a desire to document unique events.
Engages in an emotional confrontation with Steve, revealing vulnerability and apologizes showing self-awareness and emotional intelligence.
Apologizes sincerely to Steve for his outburst.
Films graves at a funeral, seems withdrawn and uncommunicative.
Refuses to answer Matt's calls and decline to stop filming despite Matt's urging.
Admits 'I don't know what I'm doing' and shows panic during the crisis.
Continues filming in the cemetery despite social pressure and Matt telling him to stop.
Refuses to put down the camera and talk honestly with Matt despite Matt's urgent pleading and emotional distress.
Avoids sharing what really happened and denies knowing the truth to Matt, showing reluctance to connect or be open.
Refuses to put down the camera and refuses to communicate openly with Matt about a serious incident.
Uses telekinetic powers to shove Matt backwards and fly away, demonstrating control over his abilities.
Addresses the camera directly, showing a violent act of stabbing himself but explaining he cannot be hurt due to a protective 'sheet'.
Sits alone on bleachers watching cheerleaders and Samantha sitting alone, showing isolation but no interaction.
Violently attacks Wayne after being shoved, causing Wayne to bleed and fall.
Collects and presents Wayne's bloody teeth to the camera, commenting on the violence and comparing to his friend Matt's skills.
Refuses to put away camera despite counselor's polite request, indicating a barrier to connection.
Dismisses counselor's advice about college and future opportunities.
Refuses to put away the camera despite the guidance counselor's polite request, indicating a disregard for social cues and inability to cooperate.
Dismisses the counselor’s advice about applying to college, showing close-mindedness and lack of proactive planning for his future.
Demonstrates some self-awareness by examining himself via the camera and mirror, indicating introspection and potential for self-evaluation.
Helps Sandra Detmer by assisting her to turn over and providing comfort during her pain.
Engages in telekinetic manipulation of junkyard cars, seemingly alone and possibly without permission.
Reflects on natural selection and apex predators, showing contemplation but no direct social warmth.
Helps his mother in pain by turning her over and fulfilling her request for help.
Mounts the camera awkwardly and fidgets, showing unfamiliarity with the setting and equipment.
Demonstrates skill and control by telekinetically moving and manipulating a car with ease.
Speaks haltingly and stammers when trying to explain concepts about evolution and apex predators.
Violently compresses a car and throws it into a scrap pile.
Kills a guard dog that attacked him without hesitation.
Reflects on natural instincts and morality, suggesting that humans may feel guilt unlike apex predators.
Lifts a car and compresses it skillfully in a controlled, precise way, showing mastery of his powers.
Successfully defends himself from a guard dog attack and kills the dog quickly, demonstrating quick reflexes and effective use of his abilities.
Opens the window to let Matt in, allowing his friend to check on him despite his own struggles.
Responds to Matt's concern with defensiveness and brusqueness, dismissing his friend's worries.
Does not engage in sharing or discussing his problems openly with Matt, remaining silent or evasive.
Responds to Matt's concerns by confidently asserting his strength and control over his abilities.
Stops attending school and isolates himself, avoiding contact even with friends worried about him.
Remaining mostly silent and avoiding open communication about his problems.
Dismisses Matt's concern, tells him to stay out of his life with hostility.
Calmly communicates with pharmacist to pick up his mom's medication despite financial difficulty.
Throws a rock at a house, provoking a hostile reaction from local thugs.
Does not react when confronted aggressively by the thugs, remaining calm and non-escalatory.

Carefully prepares by putting on his father's fireman's jacket, turning it inside out to expose the inner lining, and dons a gas mask to create a scary, faceless appearance before confronting the thugs.
Throws a rock to break a window, is surrounded by hostile thugs but remains calm and does not react impulsively.
Uses violent telekinetic force to injure multiple people without apparent provocation or mercy.
Collects the money from the defeated thugs after incapacitating them.
Sits alone silently counting money with an expressionless face, then shows frustration and anger.
Walks into gas station holding camera, interacts with clerk.
Uses energy wave to stop clerk from shooting, causing deadly accident and injuring bystanders.
Lies motionless, seemingly unable or unwilling to prevent subsequent disaster.
Walks confidently into the gas station holding the camera, approaches the clerk, and uses his powers to disarm and repel the armed clerk.
Fails to control the situation leading to a shotgun blast that causes a massive explosion, injuring bystanders and leaving himself burning and immobile.
Remains comatose and unresponsive after severe injury and explosion.
Telekinetically kills his father after repeated slaps and insults.
Telekinetically lifts his angry father into the air and disassembles him, decisively ending the threat.
Remains composed enough to use precise telekinetic power multiple times despite obvious pain and emotional distress.
Lets out a massive concussive blast destroying the room and the camera, showing lack of control and indiscriminate damage.
Appears floating in the sky in a hospital gown, clearly in pain and charred, unable to act or intervene.
Shoves away Matt when he tries to help him though clearly in pain and distress.
Screams at Matt and refuses to listen to him despite Matt's concern.
Relents after Matt begs him for something, indicating some temporary compliance.
Expresses agony and cries out that no one will help him.

Vomits and shows visible signs of physical distress, rejects help from Matt, screams and flails uncontrollably, causes chaos including hitting a helicopter leading to a crash, ends up severely injured and vulnerable.
Blasts people like bowling pins to escape, causing panic and fear.
Protects himself and attacks police officers after Matt is shot, showing a fierce reaction to violence against a friend.
Screams at Matt and tackles him out of the air despite Matt being injured, indicating a complex and aggressive relationship rather than warmth.
Flies low and aggressively during a fight, telekinetically lobbed street items at Matt, showing initiative and use of powers.
Is woozy, distracted, and crashes into a street-light, wiping out on asphalt, indicating poor control and lack of focus.
Struggles to stand multiple times like a wounded dog after the fight, showing physical weakness and poor resilience.
Blasts officers backward when threatened, showing quick reaction and assertiveness under pressure.
Screams in terror and is described as terrifying, possibly showing emotional instability.
Lunges at Matt, tackles him midair, slams him into a skyscraper, then lifts and bounces him against buildings.
Lays still after crash, then twitches and screams when spotlight hits him.
Follows Matt into the air, tackles him mid-flight, and aggressively slams him into a skyscraper and surrounding buildings, showing decisive and skillful use of his powers in combat.
Despite a brutal crash causing injury, Andrew is able to move and scream, indicating resilience and physical capability under extreme conditions.
Engages in reckless physical combat that results in both himself and Matt being severely injured, suggesting poor risk assessment and lack of control.
Telekinetically lifts police officers, firemen, and paramedics into the air and causes their limbs to go rigid, effectively incapacitating them.
Raises hands shakily in surrender when confronted by police guns.
Is impaled and shot by Matt after attacking others, showing no indication of remorse or conciliatory behavior in excerpt.
Raises hands shakily under fire but is protected by an invisible barrier, demonstrating some control over his powers.
Telekinetically lifts police, firemen, and paramedics into the air and immobilizes them, showing display of skill and power.
Is unexpectedly and fatally attacked by Matt, impaled by the triton and shot with a lodged bullet, indicating failure to anticipate or defend against attack.
Ignores the suffering and pleas for help from a dying Matt, showing no compassion or intervention.
